body:
I understand this might be a zookeeper issue, but it could be solved with a patch applied after extraction of the tarball, if you didn't want to wait for a zookeeper release.

compiler version:

```
Ubuntu clang version 3.5.0-4ubuntu2~trusty2 (tags/RELEASE_350/final) (based on LLVM 3.5.0)
Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
Thread model: posix
```

result of running `./bootstrap.sh`

```
/bin/bash ./libtool  --tag=CC   --mode=compile clang-3.5 -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I.  -I./include -I./tests -I./generated  -Wall -Werror  -g -O2 -D_GNU_SOURCE -MT zookeeper.lo -MD -MP -MF .deps/zookeeper.Tpo -c -o zookeeper.lo `test -f 'src/zookeeper.c' || echo './'`src/zookeeper.c
/bin/bash ./libtool  --tag=CC   --mode=compile clang-3.5 -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I.  -I./include -I./tests -I./generated  -Wall -Werror  -g -O2 -D_GNU_SOURCE -MT recordio.lo -MD -MP -MF .deps/recordio.Tpo -c -o recordio.lo `test -f 'src/recordio.c' || echo './'`src/recordio.c
/bin/bash ./libtool  --tag=CC   --mode=compile clang-3.5 -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I.  -I./include -I./tests -I./generated  -Wall -Werror  -g -O2 -D_GNU_SOURCE -MT zookeeper.jute.lo -MD -MP -MF .deps/zookeeper.jute.Tpo -c -o zookeeper.jute.lo `test -f 'generated/zookeeper.jute.c' || echo './'`generated/zookeeper.jute.c
libtool: compile:  clang-3.5 -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I./include -I./tests -I./generated -Wall -Werror -g -O2 -D_GNU_SOURCE -MT zookeeper.lo -MD -MP -MF .deps/zookeeper.Tpo -c src/zookeeper.c  -fPIC -DPIC -o .libs/zookeeper.o
libtool: compile:  clang-3.5 -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I./include -I./tests -I./generated -Wall -Werror -g -O2 -D_GNU_SOURCE -MT recordio.lo -MD -MP -MF .deps/recordio.Tpo -c src/recordio.c  -fPIC -DPIC -o .libs/recordio.o
libtool: compile:  clang-3.5 -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I./include -I./tests -I./generated -Wall -Werror -g -O2 -D_GNU_SOURCE -MT zookeeper.jute.lo -MD -MP -MF .deps/zookeeper.jute.Tpo -c generated/zookeeper.jute.c  -fPIC -DPIC -o .libs/zookeeper.jute.o
src/zookeeper.c:840:61: error: size argument in 'strncmp' call is a comparison [-Werror,-Wmemsize-comparison]
    if (strncmp(server_path, zh->chroot, strlen(zh->chroot) != 0)) {
                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~
/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/string2.h:902:42: note: expanded from macro 'strncmp'
                  ? strcmp (s1, s2) : strncmp (s1, s2, n)))
                                                       ^
src/zookeeper.c:840:9: note: did you mean to compare the result of 'strncmp' instead?
    if (strncmp(server_path, zh->chroot, strlen(zh->chroot) != 0)) {
        ^
/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/string2.h:902:25: note: expanded from macro 'strncmp'
                  ? strcmp (s1, s2) : strncmp (s1, s2, n)))
                                      ^
src/zookeeper.c:840:42: note: explicitly cast the argument to size_t to silence this warning
    if (strncmp(server_path, zh->chroot, strlen(zh->chroot) != 0)) {
                                         ^
                                         (size_t)(
/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/string2.h:902:42: note: expanded from macro 'strncmp'
                  ? strcmp (s1, s2) : strncmp (s1, s2, n)))
```

moving the brace to before the != is enough.
title: zookeeper compilation error under clang-3.5
